channel.title: Attemped Murder= Murder
channel.description: If i tried to kill someone I only get maybe 25 years in prison.Now if i do kill someone i get life in prison.To me its the same,If you tried to kill someone you should be charged the same way as if you did kill someone.Now Why do they charge them diffrently?If someone tryed to kill someone once whose to say they wont do it again.They might come back even harder on the person who they tried to kill,Post your opinions please.

item.title: Attemped Murder= Murder
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

legend rene:

Dont kill or attempt to kill one , your whole life will be ruined ( experienced person speaking )

I know from experience that trying to kill somebody will fuck up your life, but thats not part of the of this thread, its to discuss is Attempted murder the same as murder.

Read full topic

item.title: Attemped Murder= Murder
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

xxlegitxx:

Oh, another thing. If someone raped your daughter, and you found out, and you shot him, you could get off with involuntary manslaughter, rather than homicide.

No, you would get 5-7 years and Therapy for Murder of Passion.

Read full topic

item.title: Attemped Murder= Murder
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

PaulT:

[quote]but, if you were driving your car one day and you bent dont to pick up a french frie that you droped and ran an old person over. that could be 25 years, because it was not intended just a carless mistake.

Well man, that’s wrong. You could be charged with vehicular homicide and serve 20 to life but chances are if you can prove it was an accident you can get off with “Involuntary Manslaughter” and only serve a few months or get probation. Depends on your lawyer, not the situation.

Basically law is fucked up and stupid…the Mark Twain quote above summarizes that point of view.[/quote]
Damn right ^

Read full topic

item.title: Attemped Murder= Murder
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:19, topic:120084”][quote author=therealjdb link=topic=169528.msg1592393#msg1592393 date=1184319631]

a highway isnt private property, therefor you cant tresspass. and pedestrians have the right of way oposed to cars.

There are also signs around here saying that pedestrians and bicyclists are prohibited on the highways.
[/quote]
Where do you live o.O?
In Ohio, and most of the U.S. motor vehicles have to respect pedestrians and cyclist. They can cross the street, but they are advised not to travel on one, or next to it. Its not illegal, but they don’t want you to do it, people could just ‘happen’ to hit you, and dissapear into the long street.[/quote]
Wisconsin, and yes they have the right of way and shit on normal roads around here but not on “freeways” or Highways(except for some rural areas)

Read full topic

item.title: Attemped Murder= Murder
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

rabcarl:

They don’t just judge the intent of what you’re doing, they judge the outcome too. So say you bent over to pick up a french fry and instead of running someone over, you crash into another car but dont hurt anyone. You won’t get in as much trouble as if you accidentally ran someone over.

A more extreme example would be this: you’re driving along Route 80, and it’s midnight. A guy dressed in all black runs across the highway, and you run him over at 60 (speed limit). With a good lawyer, you get NOTHING.

Another extreme example: you maliciously kill a 7 year old girl by sitting on her, causing her to vomit, turn blue, choke, etc. You get a $10k fine and less than a year in jail.

Read full topic

item.title: Attemped Murder= Murder

They don’t just judge the intent of what you’re doing, they judge the outcome too. So say you bent over to pick up a french fry and instead of running someone over, you crash into another car but dont hurt anyone. You won’t get in as much trouble as if you accidentally ran someone over.

item.description:

PaulT:

[quote]Anyhow if you fail at killing someone you should’ve planned better maybe the government feels bad and thinks giving them 25 years to revise their plan will help them out.

Yes, and there’s lots of practice in prison as well.[/quote]
“how to stab someone in the bum”

This thread is a bit like minority report. In the end i believe it all fails majorly and they dont arrest people for being about to murder someone.

PaulT:

[quote]but, if you were driving your car one day and you bent dont to pick up a french frie that you droped and ran an old person over. that could be 25 years, because it was not intended just a carless mistake.

Well man, that’s wrong. You could be charged with vehicular homicide and serve 20 to life but chances are if you can prove it was an accident you can get off with “Involuntary Manslaughter” and only serve a few months or get probation. Depends on your lawyer, not the situation.

Basically law is fucked up and stupid…the Mark Twain quote above summarizes that point of view.[/quote]

yes but they most likely wouldent serve 25 years to life, because they werent doing anything illigal at the time like drunk driving or getting high, or even talking on there cell phone.allthough they shouldent have been taking their eyes off the road, it was not intended and was a simple mistake.

Read full topic

item.title: Attemped Murder= Murder
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Now Why do they charge them diffrently?

Because the law recognizes intent as a valid means of prosecution. And, moreover, lawyers rule the world. Justice is for the poor not the rich.

Read full topic

item.title: Attemped Murder= Murder
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

but, if you were driving your car one day and you bent dont to pick up a french frie that you droped and ran an old person over. that could be 25 years, because it was not intended just a carless mistake.

Well man, that’s wrong. You could be charged with vehicular homicide and serve 20 to life but chances are if you can prove it was an accident you can get off with “Involuntary Manslaughter” and only serve a few months or get probation. Depends on your lawyer, not the situation.

Basically law is fucked up and stupid…the Mark Twain quote above summarizes that point of view.

Read full topic
